summary: This is a sealed transcript of a conference before Chief District Judge Colleen McMahon regarding a grand jury subpoena (19 Misc. 149). The government attorney explains that the investigation opened in late November/early December 2018 and that the U.S. Attorney's Office had contacted the Boies Schiller law firm, among others, regarding their representation of victims or witnesses. The judge grants the government's request related to the subpoena.

persons.name: Colleen McMahon
persons.context: Presiding judge over the conference regarding the grand jury subpoena; questions the government attorney about contacts with the Boies Schiller firm.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Listed as the United States Attorney in the appearances section of the transcript.

events.title: Investigation Opened (possibly)
events.description: The government attorney states the investigation was opened either on Friday, November 30, or Monday, December 3.

events.title: Investigation Opened (possibly)

events.title: Court Conference on Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: A sealed conference before Judge McMahon where the government explains the timeline of its investigation and its contacts with victim/witness counsel, including the Boies Schiller firm. The judge grants the government's request.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a sealed transcript of a court conference regarding a grand jury subpoena (case 19 Misc. 149).
The government investigation into the subject (implied to be Jeffrey Epstein or related matters) opened in late November or early December 2018.
The U.S. Attorney's Office contacted the Boies Schiller law firm early in the investigation because the firm was identified as representing victims or witnesses.
Judge Colleen McMahon references wanting to avoid a 'Chemical Bank kind of situation,' suggesting concern about procedural propriety or ex parte communications.
The judge grants the government's request related to the subpoena after being satisfied with the explanation of contacts with counsel.
